headline: Ground Beef Shepherd's Pie
description: This shepherd's pie with ground beef is packed with fresh vegetables for a baked casserole topped with creamy mashed potatoes and Cheddar cheese.

video.description: See a quick-and-easy version of beefy shepherd’s pie.
video.name: Ground Beef Shepherd’s Pie

name: Ground Beef Shepherd's Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add ground beef and basil. Cook and stir until beef is crumbly and browned, about 5 minutes. Mix in green beans, tomatoes, and garlic; cook until beans are slightly softened, about 5 minutes more. Transfer to the prepared casserole dish.
Mix together mashed potatoes, water, and beaten egg in a medium bowl until smooth. Spread evenly over beef mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes start to brown on top, 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: As alot of reviews have mentioned, this is a great base recipe to start with. I went with a couple of ideas from other reviews; I too, added the garlic powder, onion powder, hot pepper flakes, salt & black pepper (w/the basil), to the ground meat and onion mixture. Then the diced tomatoes and a can of (drained), mixed veggies instead of the green beans. I also added the can of cream of mushroom soup... However, I think I will leave the mushroom soup out of it next time as mine came out kind of like a thick stew. You can see it in my photo as the mashed potatoes started to sink, lol. The taste was definately still there though! We really liked it. I will add it to our recipe rotation.
Second time I have tried it. Enjoyable.

Omitted oil. Fried the onions with the beef. Used a bag of mixed vegetables in place of beans and also added a chopped green pepper. Used 4 large potatoes and added one egg, water, 1 tablespoon butter and a splash of whipping cream when mashing them. This was an easy recipe and made a great casserole. Hubby loved it.
Instead of using green beans I cut up baby carrots and sauteed them in butter and brown sugar and then mixed them in with the hamburger mix. Limit the amount of sugar so not to sweet.

Very good ! I doubled the meat, potatoes and egg . I chose mushrooms, celery and carrots sautéed separately ( adding the carrots for the last minute or two) & layers it on top of the meat . I used the potato water in the potato/egg mashup . Also added Worcestershire and marinara sauce to the meat & onion while frying it up . Delicious and a big hit
So easy and tasty
This turned out really nicely. The kids enjoyed it.
Loved it!

This was pretty good. You will note that the recipe does not mention any use of salt or pepper. I added it to the meat mixture as well as to the mashed potatoes. It needed it. It was still sort of bland. Not sure if I’ll make it again. Also, the recipe does not specify that the tomatoes should be seeded. I did do that.

This was completely different than the shepherds pie I am used to but I love to try new things- in this case, that was a mistake. From flavorless filling (which could be fixed if you find a spicing you love) to the bizarre potato topping, that would have totally failed if not for the cheddar cheese, this was not a dish anyone in my family cared for, with 2 people refusing to eat it. There are many recipes for this same thing... you may want to look elsewhere.
Good basic recipe. I spice mine up a little more and add worcestershire sauce to the meat while it cooks adds a bit of tang.
Really good, husband actually went for seconds. I did as others have said and made the potatoes as I would regular mashed potatoes and it worked out very nicely.
Minus green beans (yucky) ??
I added a can of corn along with the green beans and diced tomatoes. My family gobbled it up! It also goes great with corn bread.
I don't like to be negative about others efforts but this left me flat. I will say a little but of ketchup on the side made it much better.

I red the reviews before making this recipe,I added fresh carrots and cooked them with the onion and garlic,I used canned diced tomatoes and used other spices such as ground red pepper (cayenne),Paprika, ground pepper, Italian seasonings, I added canned green beans. For the mashed potatoes I added butter and milk I did use the egg. I put shredded sharp cheddar on top until it melted. I cooked it in my cast iron skillet. It was delicious, and easy to make.

Yes, I made changes! I don't like tomatoes so I used 2 tbs tomato paste. And I used frozen green beans!
I liked it and my husband loved it!
I added corn. It was very good. I just was looking for a little more "zing". Still, we would make it again.
Great easy dish. Used boxed potato flakes to make mashed potatoes. Seasoned ground beef to my liking, while using some of the suggested ingredients. Family enjoyed it, and ate it all!
Very easy and my family loved it! I served with delicious buttermilk biscuits. Thank you for the recipe!
This has become a staple in our househod! I typically use 2 Roma tomatoes, and one can of french style green beans. Ive had this recipe printed for over 9 years!

Needs salt and pepper. 
It was very good and we will make it again.

It was okay, but a bit watery and flavorless. At the very least it needs some salt. I would add taco seasoning to the ground beef next time. I used a package of instant mashed potatoes and a lot more cheese. You can't have too much cheese, IMHO.
I’m always on the lookout for recipes with ground burger. This was really good and even the kids loved it. My only critique is that it needed salt, but very easy to add.
Easy, relatively quick. Great for leftovers too!!

I did make some changes I brown my hamburger meat with my onion at the same time and I put my carrots in some butter in a skillet to soften those and I put that on top of my hamburger meat in a 13 by 9 dish and then once my potatoes were boiled I added the egg and water as directed and put those on the top baked it for 15 mins then put the cheese on top finish the last 5 minutes just us the recipe calls for and then I melted some butter in a cup in the microwave and put it on top just to give it a little more moisture and flavor and it is amazing!
I made some changes to the recipe and everyone loved. I seasoned more adding a beef bouillon, can of mushrooms and Peruvian yellow chilly paste.
good base. I added extra spices and salt and pepper to make it more palatable for us.

I cooked the ground beef first & drained it & set aside. Then I cooked the onions and chopped carrots instead of green beans. Added sliced mushrooms after about 10 minutes. After another 10 minutes added the cooked ground beef. Cooked a bit to warm up the beef then put in the casserole dish and topped with mashed potatoes & cheese. I used more cheese than recipe called for. My husband went back for seconds!
Just ommited tomatoes for R&A

I have been looking for a mainstay recipe to make on a rotating basis and this is definitely that type of recipe. I gave it four stars for great dish but needed a bit of flavoring. I added a little salt and pepper this time and may add more next time I make it, doubled the garlic for my own liking, and I used ready made potatoes to make it even more simple to make. It was simply delicious. My husband and son went back for seconds and there was no leftovers.
I would double amount of spices. I substituted black beans instead of green beans, and added 1 stick butter to mashed potatoes. Next time I may add corn and/or carrots.

Very simple and quick recipe! And as other reviews said it is a great base recipe to make your own and add or take away whatever ingredients you decide. I was trying to make something quick since my husband had to go to a meeting so instead of making mashed potatoes from scratch I used a half a bag of frozen mashed potatoes. I also used half a bag of frozen mixed veggies thawed in the microwave instead of fresh green beans. I didn't realize I was out of onions so I used onion powder as a substitute. I also skipped adding the egg to the mashed potatoes but from what I read in the reviews I shouldn't have skipped that. (I will try that the next time I make it!) The last thing I changed was that after I cooked the dish for the 15 minutes I put it under the broiler for a few minutes to get the mashed potatoes a little bit browned. (I skipped the cheddar cheese on top.) My husband and I enjoyed this dish!
Added carrots with the green beans... delicious
Easy, quick, and delicious. The only changes I made were a 1/2 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce added to the meat mixture and instant mashed potatoes.
Used regular potatoes rather than sweet. It was terrific.
Used regular potatoes rather than sweet. It was terrific.
The recipe turned out quite bland. I did use turkey insteaf of beef cuz its all I had.
I substituted corn instead of green beans and I choose to do shredded cheese throughout the whole dinner usually I don't do onion but I did this time around.
Simple recipe easy to make. It took no time at all to make.
Great recipie I left out the peas and substituted green beans also used can of creamed corn under potatoes turned out great was gone and every body loved it
Didn't taste good to neither my husband nor I. Sorry.
Great recipe! I doubled everything and added peas. Family loved it!

My family likes this recipe but I make some changes. I use two pounds of ground turkey. I cook the onion with the turkey, then add in diced tomatoes, 2 cups of thawed mixed veggies (peas, corn, green beans, etc), and a small jar of turkey gravy. Add seasoning as preferred--I often add garlic and Italian seasoning. Put that in the casserole pan and top with 1 packet of instant mashed potatoes, prepared as usual and with an egg added in. Top with cheese and bake.

We loved this recipe. It's so simple and delicious. 

I had a little over two pounds of ground beef, so I had to double some seasoning. I also had a stock pile of canned goods, I used over fresh - still delicious.

My changes:
Cook the onion with the beef instead of in oil first. 
Add a can of green beans and a can of sweet corn, forego the tomatoes.
Drain the ground beef mixture.
Added a can of cream of mushroom, a can cream of chicken, 1.5 tsp worcestershire, then salt and pepper to taste.
I also used instant potatoes made to its own recipe instead and topped with colby jack.
Only thing I did different was I added green pepper if I could give this recipe higher than 5 stars it would be 50 stars it was so delicious thanks for sharing it

It was just OK. The flavors were good but the filling tasted dry. It needed about double the potatoes that it called for. Easy, potentially good recipe if more potatoes were used and some kind of sauce or broth was added to the filling.

I will definitely make this again. Minimal prep work and it was delicious. I had to substitute mixed vegetables for the green beans and it worked out fine. I also doubled the recipe and that worked out great too. This is a keeper.
I had found a great recipe for Sheaprd's Pie on this site and then lost it. Unfortunately, this one is fine but not awesome. I'll keep looking.
definitely will
Great recipe after following a reviewers suggestions by adding cream of mushroom, heavily seasoned, and doubling the mashed potatoes.
VERY bland. I will have to play with the seasoning next time.

I added lamb fat that I keep frozen from a time when I did lamb chops. I used a tea spoon to fry the ground meat. It ads a nice lamb flavor with out having to spend on expensive lamb meat

Excellent base recipe I made some adjustments. I seasoned ground beef with salt and garlic salt to taste I used canned diced tomatoes. I used quite a few golden potatoes because they are small so I probably used 3 regular sized potatoes. I added ghee and sour cream and salt to the mashed potatoes. I couldn't stop eating it. Very good next time I make it I'll use carrots and peas. Yum.
Simple and easy. Loved it!!!

Delicious. I used the vegetables I had on hand - green beans and corn, omitted the tomato sauce, and made the mash potatoes the way I usually do. It was easy to make and very tasty. I will definitely make it again.

Super easy to make and customize, and it was a HUGE hit, even with two very picky eaters. I'm not sure if I've ever seen them eat that fast and every last crumb of it to boot. The leftovers even were also devoured in record time. Will add this in for a regular rotation in our dinner lineup.
The entire family loved it!
Used leftover scalloped potatoes instead of mashed potatoes.

this is a very easy recipe, I change it up a bit to make it suitable for what I had in the house. I had a lb of ground meat and had no idea what to do with it. I didn't have potatos so instead I made a cauliflower mash as a substitute. l also did not have tomatoes, but did have a pack of mixed veggies in the freezer.
I like it. It's quick and easy with pretty much add or take away any ingredients you want. I recommend it.

Needed salt and pepper desperately. Pretty good for such a basic recipe, and easy to prepare if you're busy. The lack of flavor was disappointing, but oncertainly you bump up the seasoning, it's perfect.
the recipe was simple, straight forward, and VERY bland. If I made this again, i would have to add some tomato sauce, more garlic, more salt and pepper, and maybe some sort of beef broth.

One of the very best I have ever tried. Only tweaks I did was used 3 potatoes and used mixed frozen veggies which I thawed out first. The fresh tomato was a real nice touch - husband raved about it - definitely a keeper!

Pre-Mash your potatoes and pre-cook your ground beef. I didn't catch on to this tip until it was almost too late. Other than that, love the recipe! I substituted sweet potato and added more veggies (peas & corn). Tasty!
Absolutely dreadful. No flavours.
This was good but I gave it four stars instead of five because it was bland. I recommend adding salt and pepper to the ground beef and potatoes for additional flavor.
As many have said, I wish I had looked at the reviews prior to making it. It was easy but very very bland. I will remember to drain off the fat next time as there was quite a lot of liquid.
This was okay. I added some corn and doubled the amount of potatoes.
My mom use to make it. Another variable is pulled browned roast beef with can of mushroom soup added before baking.
This recipe was good. I used a packaged mix for the mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables for the green beans. My husband really liked it

Tried it and loved it but of course added a few things extra....had alot of people to cook for so did one pound of ground beef and one pound of ground turkey browned the meats and added the chopped onion then added garlic salt pepper and dried parsley. To the meat I added green beans corn tomatoes and peas. Turned out delish!!!

Great recipe that great on it's own terms BUT is great with your personal add-tos. Thank you-Allrecipes & Ginger!!! Like many of the other reviewers, I also modified the recipe. My daughter had oral surgery n I needed to do/cook "soft" recipes. I remembered when she & her sister were children, they loved SP. I was hoping that my grandchildren would, too. So, I hit the books looking for a similar recipe to the one, i cooked about 27 years ago. Ginger's came close & was at hit. I added frozen corn & used a tub of ready made Bob Evans mashed potatoes. I only heated it once & spread it over the gr. Beef mixture. It browned well & I added the cheddar cheese. Oh my, they loved it! Next time will try the complete recipe. Thank you, Ginger from my little family, the Yorks!!
Great recipe.
My family love this Sheperd's Pie!
A very satisfying dish that has now become a tradition after serving for the first time this evening. I doubled the recipe and it was superb!

Wow! Delicious! I was at first quite skeptical , but like other reviewers mentioned, I added lots more seasonings to my preferred taste (pepper, garlic powder, etc.) This was a great way to use leftover mashed potatoes from the nights before dinner :) I was shocked at the outcome- and I even used canned tomatoes, since I had no fresh tomatoes. Also, I substituted the green beans with 1 can of drained corn. Great recipe- thanks for sharing it!

I don't think I did things the right way for this. I hadn't made anything like this before, but I inherited a Dutch Oven and thought this might be a great dish to try. It turned out to be a gooey, greasy mess. I don't think I should have left the lid on during the entire baking portion, I probably used ground beef with too much fat, and even though I made a ton of mashed potatoes to go on top they didn't create the correct ratio of beef to potato to veggie. Overall, it was a bland-tasting, yucky, gross-colored first effort. My husband was a great sport, saying that it "wasn't too bad". I'm giving this a 3 because it seems many of the recipes I use through this site are bland, but the bulk of the problem was my error in preparation.

Never had shepherd's pie before, but have been wanting to try for a long time. This was a great recipe. Even the kids loved it. As I had no canned or frozen veggies on hand, I used some diced yellow and green squash for the vegetables. I doubled the amount of potatoes as I figured two would not be enough. Glad I did! I blended the potatoes with the egg and water and added some pepper and folded the cheese into them as well. Also, after reading reviews, I added garlic salt and brown gravy (from a packet) to the meat mixture. It made it much more flavorful. The only thing I will change in the future would be to not add the egg, as it made the potatoes more fluffy, but turned the dish into mush. I didn't get the desired crust from them. Also, I had to cook for an additional ten minutes and it still did not brown. When I try again without the egg, maybe it will take less time to crust. Great recipe and very versatile!
Mine came out delis! This is a good base recipe. I needed to add more potatoes, because I like to make enough for leftovers. Also, I added my own twist of seasoning.
Used this recipe with sweet mashed potato to include more fibers. The dish turned out to be very tasty. I also used diced carrots and green bell pepper since I did not have green beans.

I like this recipe I made a few changes .I added 1/2 cup of red wine 
To the recipe after i stirred in the tomatoes basil and garlic and I let it cook for 10 more minutes till the beef was well done!!!! I also added mushrooms to the mixture.

To the mashed potatoes I added some salt and pepper when I was mixing it because otherwise it's to bland in my opinion.Than I put in the oven came out amazing.it gave the recipe some kick! Bon a petit!
kids kinda liked it.... I could make adjustments
Great recipe for end of the month waiting on SS check and cleaning out the cupboard.
Very good.

We had this the other night and I was very impressed. The basil blended so nicely with all the other ingredients and made you want to go for more. Next time I think I'll leave the water out; I think it made the mashed potatoes to runny and try putting the whole thing under the broiler for a few minutes before serving to put a light crust on the mashed potatoes, other than that I don't think I'd change a thing.
yes, very good but I added Worcestershire sauce for added taste.
I made mine with a mixture of white and sweet potatoes, so it's Sweet Potato Shepard Pie!
Needs more seasoning

I've never made Shepherd's Pie and have never had it in my life. Frankly the thought of making this was intimidating but the recipe was easy enough to follow and our household loved it. We can't wait to make it again!

General format for the meal is patently plain and to a certain degree is attractive for a quick and uncomplicated meal. After regaling the family with recipe results, I have deduced that with simple additaments, the meal would be enhanced by slight modifications to the potatoes and the meat. The potatoes need more, perhaps butter to liven up the taste. Next, the meat was in need of more spicing which can be accomplished by adding a more powerful assortment of spices. I am certain that sautéing the brown onions with minced shallots, minced garlic, minced green onions, and very finely minced green jalapeno in olive oil, then combining with parsley, oregano, eggs and Italian bread crumbs, all added to the mixtures above before cooking would yield a tighter and more flavorful dish. I give this recipe a 5 star for the simplicity of cooking and the reality of being able to use spices which are usually on hand. Great meal!

I liked this recipe a lot. I added stewed tomatoes, garlic powder, 3 gloves of minced garlic, green beans, and sliced carrots to mine. For the potatoes I added bacon bits, butter, and a little milk. I topped it with colby cheese. Delish! Thanks Ginger.
This is a very good staring point to making the AMERICAN version of Sheppard Pie. It allows for your own personal touches. I gave it 4 stars ONLY because I prefer the traditional style of this dish.

This recipe is quick, easy, kid friendly, inexpensive & tasty as written. I love that. We have eaten this many times. What I also love is that you really can't mess it up. Just added things we like, and it gets better and better. I have made this again tonight, this time using hot Italian sausage with the ground beef, added corn, and using tomatoes with habanero peppers. I added a can of cream of mushroom soup, some Worcester sauce, extra garlic, and mixed pepper jack cheese with my mashed potatoes this time. It's really good too. If you double everything, and put in the stuff your family likes, you can't go wrong. Thanks for this recipe. A definite keeper.

This was really great! I did put about 4-5 potatoes worth of mashed potatoes on top since we love mashed potatoes. I also used ground turkey since it was cheaper. I added a little beef base (can be found near the boullion cubes) to give it a beefy taste. It was demolished and people were milling around the stove scraping at the pan (yes, even the kids). Will make again real soon! Thanks for sharing!

Based on other reviewers' comments, and my instincts, I doubled the amount of mashed potatoes. I also wanted to use a crockpot instead of the oven, so I added about a cup of broth with the meat and vegetables. It turned out well! Removed lid from crockpot for the last thirty minutes to let condensation evaporate.

My kids that dont eat anything loved this. They didn't pick out the veggies either. I followed the recipe exactly except I seasoned the potatoes with margarine salt and pepper. I also seasoned the meat with season all as it cooked. I added about a 1/2 cup more green beans and tomatoes. I will definitely make this again.

This is a very good recipe with some changes. I doubled the potatoes and made mashed potatoes with milk instead of water.I added butter,egg seasoned with salt & pepper.I also seasoned meat with salt, pepper and I added veggies and cream of mushroom. My husband loved it. I am sure I will make it again. - Raji
